msDesc.head: Hugo de S. Caro (Hugo de Vienna), Comentarii in evangelia Lucae et Johannis; Hrabanus Maurus, De laudibus Sanctae Crucis

p.secFol: B ad eam; C et scripsit; D hortatur

supportDesc.support:
Three separate manuscripts, now of 234 membrane leaves preceded by one modern paper flyleaf and four membrane flyleaves, and followed by four membrane flyleaves and a post-medieval paper flyleaf.
Fore- and endleaves: fol. ir, number; fol. iv, blank; fols. iir-vv, Ir-IVv, text, = *A below; fol. Vrv, blank.

binding.p: Sewn on six double bands between square-edged projecting oak boards covered with white alum-tawed sheepskin (s. xviii). On the spine is a black leather lozenge-shaped label with I on it. The pastedowns and the front flyleaf (fol. i) are modern. For the other flyleaves see part 1 under Contents and Structure, Script, Decoration below. Edges are yellowed and there is a fore-edge title.

history.provenance: The three parts may have come separately to All Souls (although B and C are listed as one in the Vellum Inventory (MS 399): see below) or may have been put together by Thomas Wynterburn, fellow, d. 1478(see BRUO, 'Winterborne'), who wrote his name at the end of the last part (fol. 234v: Tiber thome Wynterburn). Section D gives a strong impression of having been rarely used: the pages are unusually clean and fresh and apart from three or four neat corrections in the text or margins they are totally free from annotations. At the bottom of fol. 117r is an erased inscription, not recoverable by ultraviolet light, judging by its position probably an ex libris. Listed in the Vellum Inventory (MS 399): Ker, All Souls, no. 557 in List VI, which is probably a list of books put into the chained collection tempore Warden Stokes, 1466-94. No. 1434 (33) in CMA. At the bottom of fol. 3r is ex libris style 1, Liber Collegij animarum omnium fidelium defunctorum de Oxon and at the head of the text are titles in a fine italic hand of s. xvi, found also in MSS 20 and 28. All Souls library identifications, on which see Introduction, are, on the front pastedown, vv.1.9 and ww:4:i (both deleted); M.S. 29 (figure added),152 (pencil), L.R. 6.a.7 (pen cil), and bookplate no. 8; on fol. ir is 5..7 ( pencil).

recordHist.source: Andrew G. Watson, A Descriptive Catalogue of the Medieval Manuscripts of All Souls College Oxford (Oxford, 1997)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact library@all-souls.ox.ac.uk.

msItem.incipit: Fol. Ira. || [Text] rerum disposicio eis prohibetur. ||
Fol. Ira. [Gloss] opcio. Item sentencia femine et serui confirmatur
msItem.explicit: Fol. IVv. [text] <non de presbitero sciendum est quia>
Fol. IVv. Hec cunt originaliter uerba Gregorij ||
msItem.author: Gratian
msItem.title: Decretum
msItem.note: Binding leaves from a copy of Gratian's Decretum with the gloss of Bartholomaeus Brixiensis, s. xivin. When arranged in their proper order: I, III, iii, v, ii, iv, II, IV, they give a continuous section of the text (the inner four bifolia of a quire), II. ix. 2, 3 to II. xi. 1, 38, ed. Friedberg, CIC i. 603-34. The text and gloss are printed together in the Venice edition of 1496 (Hain 7915), our text from fol. 146vb/26 to fol. 153vb/30 and the gloss from fol. vb/3 to fol. 153vb/27. Fols. ii and IV were the pastedowns.

supportDesc.support: (Fols. ii—v, I—IV), membrane leaves of average quality, now in two quires of four but formerly four bifolia from the centre of a quire. Folded HSOS. Trimmed at the bottom and fols. ii and iv also at the top with loss of text of the gloss.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in two central columns of variable height and 75-80mm width with gloss on all sides. 49-52 lines of text and probably, before trimming, 80 of gloss. Prickings lacking. Lightly ruled in crayon.

handDesc.handNote: An untidy gothic rotunda bookhand, English, s. xivin, by one scribe. Punctuation by medial point.

decoDesc.decoNote: Spaces with guide letters left for initials.

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 29, part B

msItem.incipit: Fol. 1r. Zacharias .6. Vidi et ecce 4or quadrige egredientes de medio duorum montium Et montes illi montes erei reuelacionem reuelant
msItem.explicit: Fol. 109r. seruorum tuorum secundum benediccionem Aaron da populo tuo. Hic explicit lucas.
msItem.author: Hugo de S. Caro
msItem.title: Commentarius in evangelium S. Lucae

listBibl.bibl: Domini Hugonis Cardinalis, Postilla sea diuina expositio in altos quatuor Evangeliorum apices (Paris, 1545), fols. 115v-252;

msItem.note: As far as fol. 109rb/26 ruine reparacionem the manuscript agrees with edn. fol. 252rb/12 but thereafter the remaining thirty-five lines of manuscript and fifteen lines of printed text differ.

msItem.incipit: Fol. 110v. Abbas nota contra abbates et inanem gloriam 24.G
msItem.title: An index to item 1, unprinted.
msItem.note: Distinctiones in margins are probably copied from an exemplar. Fol. 116v is blank.

supportDesc.collation: Quired 1-58 610 78 810 9-148. All except the last with catchwords. A series of quire signatures, small letters a—n with arabic figures as far as the leaf before the centre of the quire.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in two columns, each 29590-5 C. 50-60 lines. Pricked in outer margins and for verticals. Ruled in crayon.

handDesc.handNote: Anglicana influenced by secretary, and with single-compartment a, perhaps by a single scribe. Punctuation by spare use of low point.

decoDesc.decoNote: A few two/four-line red initials (with guide letters).

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 29, part C

msItem.incipit: Fol. 117r. Hugo de Vienna super Iohannem. Ego ex ore altissimi prodij
msItem.explicit: Fol. 194r. perambulancium in dilictis suis. Explicit exposicio Hugonis de Vienna super Johannem.
msItem.author: Hugo de S. Caro
msItem.title: Commentarius in evangelium S. Johannis

listBibl.bibl: Domini Hugonis Cardinalis, Postilla sea diuina expositio in altos quatuor Evangeliorum apices (Paris, 1545), fols. 252-358v;

supportDesc.support: (Fols. 117-94), good-quality membrane leaves. Folded HSOS, except quire 16, FSOS.
supportDesc.collation: Quired 15-1610 178 1810 19-238. All except the last with catchwords of which some are red, some are in boxes touched with red, and some in ink cartouches.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in two columns, each 290-30090-5 C. 62-78 lines. Pricked in outer margins and for verticals. Ruled in crayon.

handDesc.handNote: A neat hybrida by several scribes. Punctuation by low point.

decoDesc.decoNote: A few two-line red initials, and occasional long ones flourished in penwork in margins.

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 29, part D

msItem.rubric: Fol. 195r. [Prologue] Intercessio albini pro mauro. Sancte dei presul meritis in secula uiuens
msItem.incipit: Causam quam fecimus suscipe mente pia
msItem.explicit: Fol. 195v. sancte tuis ouibus pape beate ualete.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 196r. [Text] Hortatur nos lex diuina ad deferendum domino dona
msItem.explicit: Fol. 233r. ibique tibi laus perpetua per cuncta sonabit secula. Amen. Explicit Rabanus de laude crucis. qui quondam erat abbas fuldensis. et postea archiepiscopus maguncie ordinatus est. [anno domini. dcccxvi added in crayon, s. xv].
msItem.author: Hrabanus Maurus
msItem.title: De laudibus Sanctae Crucis

listBibl.bibl: The prologue pr. by E. Dümmler, Poeta Latini aevi Carolini (MGH Poetae Latini 2; Berlin, 1884), 159-62.
On the work and for other early editions see Verfasserlexikon, 2nd edn. iv. 182-3;
and particularly Ulrich Ernst, Carmen figuratum: Geschichte des Figurengedichte von den antiken Urspriingen bis zum Ausgang des Mittelalters (Cologne etc., 1991), 2-332.

msItem.note: Fols. 233v-234v are blank except for the Wynterburn ex libris on fol. 234v (see History below).

supportDesc.support: (Fols. 195-234) very good-quality, thick, white membrane leaves, rather matt. Folded HSOS.
supportDesc.collation: Quired 24-288. All except the last leaves with catchwords written by the scribe.

layoutDesc.layout: Prickings once probably in outer margins trimmed away: only those for verticals remain in the top margin. Neatly ruled in ink. Written in long lines, 315230 C.51-63 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Gothic rotunda/semiquadrata bookhand. Punctuation by low and medial points.

decoDesc.decoNote: Much use of bright red initials, one/four-line, with guide letters. The more elaborate (four-line) initials are red with a white pattern and occasionally with red flourishing.
The same bright red is used for rubrics and for alternate lines of verse in the prologue.

The elaborate diagrams found in this text each occupy most of a verso page and are bordered in green, buff, brown, and red: these colours are used for the diagrams themselves. Few of the diagrams have been completely coloured although spaces have been left for the usual abstract or human or animal shapes. Spaces for simple geometrical shapes have also been left, and spaces for more complicated symbols (evangelist symbols, fol. 21v; the author at the foot of the Cross, fol. 224v). Alexander and Temple, no. 482
